channel.title: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers

item.title: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers
item.dc:creator: @da_real_hype da real hype
item.description:
@da_real_hype wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:541247”]I don’t know why there’s an obsession with low experience rates. It basically locks any gainfully employed person from making it far in the game.
Has anybody ever considered ‘seasonal’ gameplay? In other words, experience rates are higher (not unreasonably high though), perhaps some mechanism such as rest could exist for casual players. And at the end of the season, which is clearly defined, everything is wiped for people to start over again (and perhaps some new features can be introduced for the new season each time).

You get the balance between server longevity, which rapid experience PK servers never have, while also making it possible for casuals to progress far enough in the game to have fun with it.[/quote]

You can only do what the programmer wants to do… but i have thought about ways to implement a soft reset…

Read full topic
item.source: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers

item.title: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers
item.dc:creator: @KizL KizL
item.description:
@KizL wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:9, topic:541247”]I don’t know why there’s an obsession with low experience rates. It basically locks any gainfully employed person from making it far in the game.
Has anybody ever considered ‘seasonal’ gameplay? In other words, experience rates are higher (not unreasonably high though), perhaps some mechanism such as rest could exist for casual players. And at the end of the season, which is clearly defined, everything is wiped for people to start over again (and perhaps some new features can be introduced for the new season each time).

You get the balance between server longevity, which rapid experience PK servers never have, while also making it possible for casuals to progress far enough in the game to have fun with it.[/quote]you were never meant to get 99 and not many did. The ones that wish to do so could and can if a server like this is made. The ones who don’t have lower level accounts. Did any of you have higher level accounts? I know I didn’t have many 90+stats til after 4 years. But i never cared if i had my good items to kill people and made good cash from it that’s all that mattered.

~K!zL

Read full topic
item.source: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers

item.title: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I don’t know why there’s an obsession with low experience rates. It basically locks any gainfully employed person from making it far in the game.
Has anybody ever considered ‘seasonal’ gameplay? In other words, experience rates are higher (not unreasonably high though), perhaps some mechanism such as rest could exist for casual players. And at the end of the season, which is clearly defined, everything is wiped for people to start over again (and perhaps some new features can be introduced for the new season each time).

You get the balance between server longevity, which rapid experience PK servers never have, while also making it possible for casuals to progress far enough in the game to have fun with it.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers

item.title: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Godandjesus:

I don’t want to be rude, but what makes you think that any experienced programmer would stick with totally random guy without any experience?

I learned by chatting with Reines and writing basic scripts. Eventually picked up a source and have done hardly anything compared to some of the experienced guys that have actually done the real development. It’s a great thing for people to teach others or point them in the right direction. Something the community is lacking

Read full topic

item.title: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Feel free to add me on Skype and we can chat some. [Blackwolfmarwood] I’m curious about the XZ Networks linux VPS that utilizes Xen virtualization. VPS boxes running OpenVZ are no good for hosting java game servers because memory is not allocated in large contiguous blocks the way VPS boxes using Xen can and that means needing far more RAM to host a world server than necessary.

Three things would be needed for hosting a stable server at a reasonable cost:


Option #1:
1 starter linux VPS with 1GB RAM and 200GB bandwidth: https://www.xznetworks.com/linuxvps - $12.99/mo
1 TCP reverse DDoS proxy https://www.xznetworks.com/proxy - $8.99/mo
1 HTTP reverse DDoS proxy: https://www.xznetworks.com/proxy - $12.99/mo

Total: $34.97/mo

Option #2:
1 starter linux VPS with 1GB RAM and 200GB bandwidth: https://www.xznetworks.com/linuxvps - $12.99/mo
1 TCP reverse DDoS proxy https://www.xznetworks.com/proxy - $8.99/mo
1 CloudFlare free plan http://www.cloudflare.com/plans - $0.00/mo

Total: $21.98/mo

Option #3:
1 SharkTech Plan (3) VPS (basic DDoS protection included) https://www.sharktech.net/index.php?ID=cloud_virtual_servers&PG=2 $59.00/mo
1 CloudFlare free plan http://www.cloudflare.com/plans - $0.00/mo

Total: $59.00/mo

Option #4:
1 SharkTech Chicago Atom 330 bargain dedicated server (basic DDoS protection included) https://www.sharktech.net/index.php?ID=bargainserver&PG=2 $59.00/mo
1 CloudFlare free plan http://www.cloudflare.com/plans - $0.00/mo

Total: $59.00/mo

Read full topic

item.source: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers

item.title: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Trey, tell us a bit about yourself. How long have you been playing RSC? Have you worked with other RSC private servers before? Do you know any sort of programming languages? Ever hosted a different game server, such as a minecraft server? What sort of time commitment can you put into running something? Are you employed full time? Do you play DayZ? Are you familiar with Git, Dropbox, Skype, or MySQL database administration? Do you have linux/apache hardening/mod_security or windows/IIS administration experience? Do know how to use SSH? Have you ever dealt with DDoS mitigation?

Read full topic
item.source: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers

item.title: Need Crew Want To Start A Server. Sick of Current Servers
item.dc:creator: @KizL KizL
item.description:
@KizL wrote:

DO THIS.

First off I’ll say this. You were never suppose to get flats on RSC.

  1. 1x exp that never changes unless in wild to maybe 1.2x .

  2. Has an Auction House in Varrock.

  3. Has portals. (Not in wild)

  4. P2P side of wild is 24/7 P2P Pking. Mage Arena status.

  5. 1IP only auto 5 day ban when caught.

  6. No char parking in wild, when logged sends you to Edgeville.

  7. Can log while running in wild like real RSC.

~K!zL

Read full topic
